data.meta_description: PRTM Edge students presented their capstone projects to community partners at the Barnes Center, with representatives from the City of Greer Parks, Recreation,…
data.text:
If you are a parent of school-aged children, or a teacher/ school administrator, I encourage you to give this journal a try with the kids in the early hours of the day. There is a home and a school version available, and a sports/team version I believe is in the works. Read more about the author, Katie Woods, below, and about the amazing impact A Simple Seed journal is making through its implementation in many schools throughout the United States, and even overseas!

Calling all University of Plymouth Students in my network! Are you ready to make waves and get hands-on with real-world challenges? Then join us for Plymouth's inaugural Ocean Hackathon from November 17-19, 2023, at the Real Ideas Market Hall. Let's create a brighter, cleaner future for our oceans, together! 🌟 What's the Ocean Hackathon, you ask? It's a global competition where teams dive headfirst into ocean-themed challenges and create innovative solutions using marine data. This year, Plymouth is one of only 16 locations worldwide chosen to host this amazing event. 🌍 Who Can Participate? Absolutely anyone with a passion for solving ocean issues! We welcome students, academics, marine experts, businesses, and the community at large to get involved. Challenge owners are seeking diverse skill sets, so everyone has something to contribute! 🧑🔬👨🎓👩💼 Why You Should Dive In: Real-World Experience: Gain hands-on experience by working on pressing ocean-related challenges. Innovate and Create: Work on new business ideas and prototypes that could make a real difference. Teamwork: Collaborate with a diverse group of individuals, pushing your boundaries and expanding your horizons. Beyond the Everyday: Step out of your routine and make a splash in the world of marine data. Plymouth Challenges Await: 📷 CoastSNAP – An image rectification and classification tool 📱 Sea-ing Differently – Connecting Children to the Sea through an innovative app 🎮 Plank-tonnes of Fun – Gamify plankton data to increase ocean literacy in non-scientific communities 🌿 From Sargassum Seaweed to Sustainable Ship Building – Addressing sustainability in ship construction Ready to take the plunge and be part of something extraordinary? Find out more about the event and how to get involved here: https://lnkd.in/e8_ybwqv Got Questions? Feel free to reach out to me or Emily Barrett. We're here to help you navigate this incredible opportunity and embark on a journey to make a difference. #OceanHackathon #PlymouthInnovation #SustainableSolutions
